page.title: 02The North Hants Ridgeway
page.content: The North Hants Ridgeway is part of the Wayfarer's Walk. This is an ancient track on a high chalk ridge running through the south of this area.The track can be followed from Basingstoke to the Vale of Pewsey in Wiltshire where it joins the Great Ridgeway. This ancient road was used by Neolithic men who lived in this country 2,000 B.C. and by Britons, Romans, and Saxons. In the Middle Ages it was still a main road from East to West.Today it is just a green track used by many walkers who enjoy the spectacular views and the many species of wild flowers which are in danger of becoming extinct.
